_source.description: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object...
_source.name: Action

children.description: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.
children.name: AchieveAction

children.description: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.
children.name: LoseAction

children.description: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.
children.name: TieAction

children.description: The act of achieving victory in a competitive activity.
children.name: WinAction

children.description: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.
children.name: AssessAction

children.description: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.
children.name: ChooseAction

children.description: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.
children.name: VoteAction

children.description: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.
children.name: IgnoreAction

children.description: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.
children.name: ReactAction

children.description: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object...
children.name: AgreeAction

children.description: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object...
children.name: DisagreeAction

children.description: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.
children.name: DislikeAction

children.description: An agent approves/certifies/likes/supports/sanction an object.
children.name: EndorseAction

children.description: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.
children.name: LikeAction

children.description: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.
children.name: WantAction

children.description: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience...
children.name: ReviewAction

children.description: The act of ingesting information/resources/food.
children.name: ConsumeAction

children.description: The act of swallowing liquids.
children.name: DrinkAction

children.description: The act of swallowing solid objects.
children.name: EatAction

children.description: The act of installing an application.
children.name: InstallAction

children.description: The act of consuming audio content.
children.name: ListenAction

children.description: The act of consuming written content.
children.name: ReadAction

children.description: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.
children.name: UseAction

children.description: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.
children.name: WearAction

children.description: The act of consuming static visual content.
children.name: ViewAction

children.description: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.
children.name: WatchAction

children.description: An agent controls a device or application.
children.name: ControlAction

children.description: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g...
children.name: ActivateAction

children.description: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e...
children.name: DeactivateAction

children.description: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e...
children.name: ResumeAction

children.description: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).
children.name: SuspendAction

children.description: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.
children.name: CreateAction

children.description: The act of producing/preparing food.
children.name: CookAction

children.description: The act of producing a visual/graphical representation of an object, typically with a pen/pencil and paper as instruments.
children.name: DrawAction

children.description: The act of capturing sound and moving images on film, video, or digitally.
children.name: FilmAction

children.description: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.
children.name: PaintAction

children.description: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.
children.name: PhotographAction

children.description: The act of authoring written creative content.
children.name: WriteAction

children.description:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:


SearchAction: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.
children.name: FindAction

children.description: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.
children.name: CheckAction

children.description: The act of discovering/finding an object.
children.name: DiscoverAction

children.description:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:


FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects...
children.name: TrackAction

children.description: The act of interacting with another person or organization.
children.name: InteractAction

children.description: The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically...
children.name: BefriendAction

children.description: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.
children.name: CommunicateAction

children.description:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:


ReplyAction: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.
children.name: AskAction

children.description: The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e...
children.name: CheckInAction

children.description: The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their departure of a previously reserved service (e...
children.name: CheckOutAction

children.description: The act of generating a comment about a subject.
children.name: CommentAction

children.description: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.
children.name: InformAction

children.description: The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected...
children.name: ConfirmAction

children.description: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.
children.name: RsvpAction

children.description: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.
children.name: InviteAction

children.description: The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object...
children.name: ReplyAction

children.description: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.
children.name: ShareAction

children.description: The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from...
children.name: FollowAction

children.description: An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location...
children.name: JoinAction

children.description: An agent leaves an event / group with participants/friends at a location...
children.name: LeaveAction

children.description: The act of marrying a person.
children.name: MarryAction

children.description: The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page...
children.name: RegisterAction

children.description: The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to...
children.name: SubscribeAction

children.description:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:


RegisterAction: antonym of UnRegisterAction...
children.name: UnRegisterAction

children.description:
The act of an agent relocating to a place.

Related actions:


TransferAction: Unlike TransferAction, the subject of the move is a living Person or Organization rather than an inanimate object.
children.name: MoveAction

children.description: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.
children.name: ArriveAction

children.description: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.
children.name: DepartAction

children.description: The act of traveling from an fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.
children.name: TravelAction

children.description: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.
children.name: OrganizeAction

children.description: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.
children.name: AllocateAction

children.description:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:


RejectAction: The antonym of AcceptAction.
children.name: AcceptAction

children.description: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).
children.name: AssignAction

children.description: The act of granting permission to an object.
children.name: AuthorizeAction

children.description:
The act of rejecting to/adopting an object.

Related actions:


AcceptAction: The antonym of RejectAction.
children.name: RejectAction

children.description: The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it...
children.name: ApplyAction

children.description: An agent bookmarks/flags/labels/tags/marks an object.
children.name: BookmarkAction

children.description: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.
children.name: PlanAction

children.description: The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen...
children.name: CancelAction

children.description:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:


ScheduleAction: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e...
children.name: ReserveAction

children.description:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:


ReserveAction: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e...
children.name: ScheduleAction

children.description: The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise...
children.name: PlayAction

children.description: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.
children.name: ExerciseAction

children.description: The act of participating in performance arts.
children.name: PerformAction

children.description:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:


FindAction: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.
children.name: SearchAction

children.description: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation...
children.name: TradeAction

children.description: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered...
children.name: BuyAction

children.description: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.
children.name: DonateAction

children.description: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.
children.name: OrderAction

children.description: An agent pays a price to a participant.
children.name: PayAction

children.description: An agent orders a (not yet released) object/product/service to be delivered/sent.
children.name: PreOrderAction

children.description: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.
children.name: QuoteAction

children.description: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property...
children.name: RentAction

children.description: The act of taking money from a buyer in exchange for goods or services rendered...
children.name: SellAction

children.description: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.
children.name: TipAction

children.description: The act of transferring/moving (abstract or concrete) animate or inanimate objects from one place to another.
children.name: TransferAction

children.description: The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date...
children.name: BorrowAction

children.description: The act of downloading an object.
children.name: DownloadAction

children.description: The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination...
children.name: GiveAction

children.description: The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date...
children.name: LendAction

children.description: The act of transferring money from one place to another place...
children.name: MoneyTransfer

children.description: The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object thathas been transferred from an origin to a destination...
children.name: ReceiveAction

children.description: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).
children.name: ReturnAction

children.description: The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination...
children.name: SendAction

children.description: The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction...
children.name: TakeAction

children.description: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.
children.name: UpdateAction

children.description: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.
children.name: AddAction

children.description: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.
children.name: InsertAction

children.description: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.
children.name: AppendAction

children.description: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.
children.name: PrependAction

children.description: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.
children.name: DeleteAction

children.description: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.
children.name: ReplaceAction
